name: overmedicated
text: A comment left by overmedicated was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by wharfrat, radarjammer, rowboat, Boredom_Man, seren_tremio)

name: falseprophet
text: To me, the creepiest part is that one is a tall, gay cat and the other is a South American country that is also the offspring of a person singing an old Negro spiritual.

name: retardo
text: A comment left by retardo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, GMM, atticusonline, gkiyo)

name: epicurus
text: The name Dreamwheel and the Child is so perfect my mind is blown.

name: endoftheworld
text: Simon's long, striped socks add a lot to the image too. Very 70s. I can totally hear "Me and Julio Down By The Schoolyard" playing in the background too.

name: mugi
text: Chubbied for Paul Simon, but still, you're not making this any less creepy.

name: brah_angelico
text: Saturdays at Quinn Park must've been something pretty special

name: delzhand
text: The idea that Photoshop would have a filter to make a person look like a flagrant homosexual is inherently amusing.

name: agika
text: I hear it was a very highly-requested feature, so they built it into the latest version.

name: cailetshadow
text: It is a lie that they have added this feature, and a cruel one. It would save me so much time .

name: tekende
text: "Flagrant homosexual" is a hilarious phrase.

name: missdove
text: I prefer a nice fragrant homosexual.

name: phthoggos
text: alt text: "FILTER > OTHER > MAPPLETHORPE"

name: tekende
text: What does that even mean?

name: rmj12345
text:
Mapplethorpe was a photographer whose phallocentric photographs (subtle or otherwise) set off a culture war. At the center of this battle were Jesse Helms and Dick Armey (which sounds like a fake name for Sen. Circus Penis).

The OP was referencing a famous artist focusing on homosexuality to make a joke about the Photoshop filter in a joke made by a cartoon cat to a stuffed bear. It was a good joke, and funny.

name: rmj12345
text: And by OP, I mean Onstad. D'oh.

name: tekende
text: Ah, okay, excellent. Thanks for the explanation!

name: terribleman
text: The more you know

name: zem
text: This is a 5 for Portland and for Beef's lines in panels 10 and 13

name: centipede_damascus
text: Portland is an awesome city. It is known for its soft souls and the awesome Saturday Market in Burnside.

name: semiquaver
text: It is my city. And yes, the market is such as astonishing. I will be there tomorrow and I will rejoice.

name: captneko
text: Mine as well, and I also frequent that market. I wonder if we've met.

name: semiquaver
text: Probably.  I'm at school right now but when I get home for break I will be there every Saturday once more.

name: mystkmanat
text: I desperately hope to attend college there (at Reed).  Anything I should know about the fair city of Portland?

name: rowboat
text: I'm sorry to have to be the one to tell you this, but it's kind of not there anymore.

name: mystkmanat
text: ...what?

name: rowboat
text:
I'm so sorry....

I hear Provo is nice.

name: skellingtonloc
text: I always sort of thought that Teodor would be the one who turns out to be gay, but I guess he just likes the Cure.

name: nathanielperson
text: Teodor is, at the least, bicurious (see "Hiram the Blacksmith").

name: awko
text: He's just role-playing. If you break character the game gives your family dysentery.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it just makes sense.

name: paperboy_2000
text: This is another chock full strip that could have ended on panel 4,6,7,10, or 11 and still been great. The Dreamwheel & The Child frame is indeed perfect. I like the concept of a false Thanksgiving, and I really want to know how Beef envisions pulling it off. But Téodor is wise enough to just let that comment go.

name: hellofyellin
text:
Beef's first idea for reconciliation is a false Thanksgiving.

I'm not going to say it, but you know what I'm thinking.

It rhymes with third-gum glances .

name: nigelchaos
text: I have *no idea* what you're thinking. I fail.

name: hellofyellin
text: (I did not want to say "circumstances".)

name: nigelchaos
text: I should've known that. Allow me to dock my slowboat.

name: thesyndicate88
text: For some reason, I keep pronouncing 'glances' with a lisp, despite not typically having said lisp.

name: rowboat
text: Off to Portland with you, then.

name: latterman
text: This is the absolute best turn Pat's character could have taken. The runner-up has the Mexican camera revealing him to have an uncontainable desire to start a family with Bea Arthur. Yeah, Onstad chose correctly.

name: tekende
text: The concept of being so angry you rent someone an apartment in another city nets this strip a five.

name: geekthras
text: It is the angriest a person can be, to do this

name: fidelio-roo
text: "FILTER-- OTHER-- MAPPLETHORPE" was the funniest anything I have ever read. Seriously.

name: epicurus
text: Pat's father has good muscle definition on h- OH SHIIIIIIIITTTTTTTTT!!!!!

name: bixschmix
text: Am I seriously the first nerd to comment on the perfection of the last panel? That fuckin Logo turtle. He used to run and play and he merely sits and stews.

name: epicurus
text: Yeah, I used to love that little Logo Turtle. I wrote a Logo program where a guy got shot by the mafia in a drive-by and then a little ambulance ran over him.

name: trollcollins
text:
I was just scrolling down to see if anyone was going to enthuse "dead tern! hooray!"

I like the last panel very much.

name: tripperday
text:
I loved the last panel too, and not just because I used to play around with Logo.

Simon genuinely cares so much he still remembers the computer languages Roast Beef wrote as a kid. Roast Beef is so considerate and respectful that he doesn't mention he hasn't programmed in Logo or Pascal in several years.

It's a very sweet moment and we see a lot about just how virtuous both characters are.

name: wingspan
text: Dammit, why doesn't this comment have a green background yet?

name: scorpio_nadir
text: You are a Frist Pots Nerd.

name: bixschmix
text: I didn't say frist... I didn't say pots... and it wasn't the first post. You confuse me.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Life is confusing. You are a serious nerd commenting about perfection, then. Have another chubby.

name: terribleman
text: Great, I was about to suggest that Beef was maybe spending a little too much time watching Animal Planet. Now I don't have to reveal that I don't know what you are talking about. Thanks.

name: ctrl_z
text: Wow Pat that's harsh, what a dick.

name: firesign
text: So, are you referring to panels 7 and 8? ...Or to panel four?

name: xiaomimi
text:
Tuesday Blogs

Onstad: The Internet is crazy for cat schlong!


Today's Blogs

Philippe: I need to join a movie-voting website!
Nice Pete: I cooked a chicken this evening, which is new to me

"As a working artist, I'm perpetually torn between the desire to put forth what I think is my pure vision for Achewood, and the desire to satisfy the reader's craving for rock-hard cat cock."

name: numberkillinger
text:
Nice Pete's blog is great .
"[Tyler Florence's hair] looked quite fine and full, but soft and easily changed."

name: mc_white
text: God I respect Roast Beef and his parent-talk, he is definitely that friend that handles all the parents soo well.

name: aargh
text: Everyone has one friend that gets on better with your parents than you do.

name: tonyhighwind
text: This comic is chock-full of goodness.  Dreamwheel and the Child, Pat making his Dad move to Portland, Beef's code vs. a dead tern AND the alt text.  I would give this a six if it were possible, it's just so damn good.

name: tonyhighwind
text: I would add raging cat boner, but that premiered last comic, this one can't really lay claim to it.
